semantic_title: Uncomplicated Delivery with Resolved Antepartum Complication
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > n. Normal Delivery, Code O80 > 2) Uncomplicated delivery with resolved antepartum complication

content.full_text: Code O80 may be used if the patient had a complication at some point during the pregnancy, but the complication is not present at the time of the admission for delivery. (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)
content.summary: Exception allowing O80 use when previous pregnancy complications have resolved by delivery admission (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)
key_concepts: O80 allowed with resolved complications (Evidence: pg no: 69, L78-L79)
Complication must not be present at delivery admission (Evidence: pg no: 69, L78-L79)
Historical complications don't exclude O80 (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O80 may be used if pregnancy complications existed but are resolved at delivery admission (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)
detailed_rules.explanation: Previous pregnancy complications that have resolved and are not present during the delivery admission do not exclude the use of O80 (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify any pregnancy complications during pregnancy
Step 2: Determine if complications are present at delivery admission
Step 3: If complications resolved, O80 may be used
Step 4: Verify all other O80 criteria are met

specific_codes.description: Encounter for full term uncomplicated delivery (Evidence: pg no: 69, L78)
specific_codes.context: May be used with resolved antepartum complications

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with previous gestational hypertension, now resolved at delivery
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 32-year-old female with history of gestational hypertension at 28 weeks, now resolved, delivered full-term healthy infant without complications
step_by_step: Step 2: Confirm hypertension resolved at delivery

correct_coding.rationale: Resolved complications don't exclude O80 use (Evidence: pg no: 69, L77-L79)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use O80 since hypertension resolved

best_practices: Verify complications are truly resolved at delivery admission (Evidence: pg no: 69, L78-L79)
common_mistakes: Not using O80 when complications have resolved
tips: Focus on current status at delivery, not historical complications
implementation_notes: Applies only when complications are completely resolved
clinical_context: Many pregnancy complications resolve before delivery
